div.head: THE FAYTHFVLL Soule, to her spouse CHRIST.
div.p: Cant. 6.I Am my welbeloveds, & my welbeloved is mine.2.
Cant. 8.Set me as a seale on thine heart,6. and as a signet vpon thine arme: for Loue is strong as death: Ielousie is cruell as the graue: the coles therof are fiery coles, and a vehement flame.

Much water cannot quench Loue,
Verse. 7. neither can the flouds drowne it: if a man should giue all the substance of his house for Loue, they would greatlie contemne it.
